headline.main: Banned Russians Quietly Added Back to Olympic Swimming
headline.print_headline: Banned Russians Quietly Added Back to Olympic Swimming

docs.snippet: Yulia Efimova will be competing at the Olympics after all....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yulia Efimova will be competing at the Olympics after all.

headline.main: Queues, Security Scares Mark Shambolic Start to Rio Games
headline.print_headline: Queues, Security Scares Mark Shambolic Start to Rio Games

docs.snippet: The Rio Olympic Games got off to a shambolic and nervous start on Saturday, with organizers apologizing to angry fans kept waiting for hours at security checkpoints to enter venues while, outside, shootings and bomb scares kept visitors on edge....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Rio Olympic Games got off to a shambolic and nervous start on Saturday, with organizers apologizing to angry fans kept waiting for hours at security checkpoints to enter venues while, outside, shootings and bomb scares kept visitors on edge.

headline.main: Nobel Laureate Stiglitz Leaves Panama Finance Committee
headline.print_headline: Nobel Laureate Stiglitz Leaves Panama Finance Committee

docs.snippet: Nobel economics laureate Joseph Stiglitz has quit a committee set up by Panama's government to study the country's financial system following the leak of a trove of data about offshore accounts set up by a Panamanian law firm....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nobel economics laureate Joseph Stiglitz has quit a committee set up by Panama's government to study the country's financial system following the leak of a trove of data about offshore accounts set up by a Panamanian law firm.

headline.main: LA Mayor: Trump Victory Could Turn Off IOC Voters to '24 Bid
headline.print_headline: LA Mayor: Trump Victory Could Turn Off IOC Voters to '24 Bid

docs.snippet: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti acknowledged Saturday that the results of November's U.S. presidential election could weigh heavily on his city's chances of hosting the 2024 Olympics, saying that a victory by Donald Trump could turn off IOC voters...
docs.lead_paragraph: Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti acknowledged Saturday that the results of November's U.S. presidential election could weigh heavily on his city's chances of hosting the 2024 Olympics, saying that a victory by Donald Trump could turn off IOC voters.

headline.main: Archery: South Korea Restore Order With Men's Team Gold
headline.print_headline: Archery: South Korea Restore Order With Men's Team Gold

docs.snippet: South Korea's archers routed the United States to win the men's team gold at the Rio Olympics on Saturday and restore a dynasty broken by the Americans at London four years ago....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea's archers routed the United States to win the men's team gold at the Rio Olympics on Saturday and restore a dynasty broken by the Americans at London four years ago.

headline.main: Making Olympic Boxing Safer by Eliminating Head Guards

docs.snippet: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions....
docs.abstract: Male boxers competing in Rio Olympics will do so without protective headgear for first time based on argument that they will be safer without it; several studies, including one commissioned by International Boxing Assn, argue that number of acute brain injuries actually declined when head guards were not in use; critics of decision say findings are suspect, and decision has more to do with drawing in fans than keeping boxers safe.
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Boxing Association decided to eliminate the guards for amateur male boxers, concluding that they did not prevent concussions.

headline.main: Boxing: Boxers Scuffed Up but Happy Sans Headgear at Rio
headline.print_headline: Boxing: Boxers Scuffed Up but Happy Sans Headgear at Rio

docs.snippet: On debut day for Olympic boxing, fighters said they were happy to be competing at the first Games since 1980 without protective headgear, welcoming better peripheral vision even if it means more cuts and scrapes....
docs.lead_paragraph: On debut day for Olympic boxing, fighters said they were happy to be competing at the first Games since 1980 without protective headgear, welcoming better peripheral vision even if it means more cuts and scrapes.

headline.main: Woman Gets Backlash for Having Invasive Bear Killed
headline.print_headline: Woman Gets Backlash for Having Invasive Bear Killed

docs.snippet: A mother of three has provoked a backlash for having a bear shot after it repeatedly broke into her Southern California mountain home....
docs.lead_paragraph: A mother of three has provoked a backlash for having a bear shot after it repeatedly broke into her Southern California mountain home.

headline.main: US Volleyball Star Took a Break to Restore Balance in Life
headline.print_headline: US Volleyball Star Took a Break to Restore Balance in Life

docs.snippet: Matt Anderson's older sister realized he really must be struggling in order to call home with news for his family that he needed an extended break from volleyball....
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Anderson's older sister realized he really must be struggling in order to call home with news for his family that he needed an extended break from volleyball.

headline.main: US Discloses More Conditions for Lethal Drone Strikes
headline.print_headline: US Discloses More Conditions for Lethal Drone Strikes

docs.snippet: The White House has released a version of President Barack Obama's 3-year-old guidance on the use of lethal force against terrorists overseas, laying out what it says are safeguards to minimize civilian deaths and errant strikes while preserving t...
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House has released a version of President Barack Obama's 3-year-old guidance on the use of lethal force against terrorists overseas, laying out what it says are safeguards to minimize civilian deaths and errant strikes while preserving the capability to take quick action with drone attacks and other means.
